headline.main: SHIP STRIKE PLOT LAID TO DOCK MEN; 4 Accused of Coercion That Led to Tie-Up of British Freighter for 2 Weeks 2 ARE FORMER CONVICTS Dewey Warns He Will Tolerate No 'Gangster Interference' With Sailing of Vessels

lead_paragraph: The arrest yesterday of four union dock workers, two of them ex-convicts, on coercion and assault charges growing out of a recent two-week strike that held up the sailing of a British freighter from West Tenth Street, brought later from District Attorney Thomas E. Dewey the warning: "I shall not tolerate gangster interefrence with the loading of ships on our waterfronts."
abstract: Warns he will not tolerate gangster interference with ship loading, Brit ship case
